meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Alison Saunders Robert Arrowood Dean Meyer Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7152.

td.p: Alison Saunders, an architectural historian from Baton Rouge, Louisiana
Robert Arrowood, a former realtor from Provincetown, Massachusetts
Dean Meyer, a scientific editor from Winder, Georgia (whose 1-day cash winnings total $18,700)

tr.td: FIRST LADIES
FOOD & DRINK
12-LETTER WORDS
(Alex: Sounds intimidating.)
MYTHOLOGY
RIGHT "UR"
JEOPARDY! ON THE MOVIE MARQUEE
(Alex: You have to give us the correct word in that response. We, uh, kind of messed with it a little bit.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '(Hi, I\'m Bellamy Young, and I play First Lady Mellie Grant on Scandal.) In 1962 millions of Americans tuned in as this First Lady took viewers on a televised "Tour of the White House"')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Hi, I'm Bellamy Young, and I play First Lady Mellie Grant on Scandal.) In 1962 millions of Americans tuned in as this First Lady took viewers on a televised "Tour of the White House"

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law. This website is not affiliated with, sponsored by, or operated by Jeopardy Productions, Inc. Join the discussion at JBoard.tv.
